Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Preferential adsorption and facilitated transport through constructed channels

Other Information.Additional Info: The Al-fu MMMs exhibited enhanced flux and separation factor due to the preferential adsorption of methanol and additional transport pathways provided by Al-fu particles.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Solution-diffusion mechanism with lower affinity compared to methanol

Other Information.Additional Info: Dimethyl carbonate permeability increased faster than methanol with temperature, affecting selectivity.
Comparable pervaporation performance observed for methanol/ethyl acetate mixtures.
Comparable pervaporation performance observed for methanol/toluene mixtures.
Achieved a separation factor of 83.3 with methanol content in permeate exceeding 95.42%.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with preferential adsorption of polar molecules

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Flux: up to 1250 g·m−2·h−1; Separation factor: up to 83.3 for methanol/MTBE mixture

Other Information.Additional Info: The membrane showed robust stability over 72 h of continuous operation and versatility in separating various methanol azeotropes.
